h3. Problem Definition
Currently , for Start Date a release option only have :-
* as early as possible
* relative to previous release date
* fixed start date
It will be better to add addition option which is *start as late as possible*

h3. Suggested Solution
Add additional option for Start Date release option with *start as late as possible* option.
fields.summary: Additional Option for Start Date a release option

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1584].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Adding estimates to an issue creates multiple new estimates. This will result is abnormally high number for estimate.

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a new issue.
# Assign it to an epic on a portfolio plan.
# Don't provide any time estimates.
# Navigate to the portfolio plan.
# Expand the epic, locate the new issue.
# In the "estimates (h)" column, add a new estimate: 1w.
# Commit the changes.
# Browse to the issue in core JIRA (i.e., /browse/KEY-123)
# Click on the "All" tab in the "Issue Activity" section.

h3. Environment

JIRA 7.1.9, JIRA Portfolio 2.0.4

h3. Expected Results

* The original estimate and remaining estimate for the issue should be set once each.

h3. Actual Results

* The original estimate field is set to 1w in the first change item.
* The original estimate and remaining estimate fields are both set to 1w in a second change item.
* The remaining estimate field is set to 1d in a third change item. 

h3.Workaround

None
fields.summary: Adding estimates to an issue creates multiple new estimates
To be able to persist and switch between multiple scenarios of a plan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently users who have Edit permission will be able to delete any of the boards available. A new Delete Plan permission is necessary to allow users creating plans freely but restrict the ability to delete plans created by other users.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a new delete plan permission that automatically has Creator and Administrator in them. The creator has the option to give the functionality to a user/group.
 
h3. Workaround 
Update the *Access control > Permission* of the recently created Plan to only selected user/group.
fields.summary: Add delete Plan permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After starting JIRA, unable to access the plan page properly


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start JIRA
# Set the *-Datlassian.plugins.enable.wait=5* (to recreate the agile unable to be started condition)
# Access the plan page

h3. Expected Results
Able to access plan page

h3. Actual Results
Hit error 500

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
java.lang.RuntimeException: javax.servlet.ServletException: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/atlassian/greenhopper/service/rank/JpoRankService
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
Restart JIRA and ensure JIRA Agile are able to be started properly

h3. Notes
This only happens when:
# JIRA Agile failed to start during JIRA start-up
# JIRA Agile was recently upgraded

Make Parent Link searchable via JQL

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, in the Portfolio Scope view, you are able to create epics. However, you are not able to easily associate existing Stories to the created epic. The user has to either go to the issue in JIRA to achieve this or go to the Agile board, where you currently have drag and drop functionality to associate stories to epics. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Have the way for users to easily associate stories to epics in the scope view itself. Perhaps a drag and drop mechanism like in JIRA Agile backlog.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1574].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, in portfolio overbooked work is distributed as evenly as possible over all the people in the team that have the skills to do them. However, this could cause confusion as in JIRA the assignee is some else compared to portfolio

h3. Suggested Solution
Give users the option to either strictly follow the assignee or once Portfolio recognizes overbooked work, it immediate asks the user to change the assignee in JIRA.
fields.summary: As a user, I want Portfolio to intelligently handle assignee when overbooked work
Option to remove the restriction of needing an estimate before inheriting the assignee from the issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1572].
  {panel}

If we have Team A working on Project A and Team B working on Project B and there is a Project C in the pipeline I want to be able to see which team can pick up the work.

If all the work in project C has been scoped out and imported into the plan I want to be able to assign the board to Team A while still having project A aligned to Team A. This would then allow me to see when project C is likely to start and the sprints will marry up correctly where as at the moment if I team up project C to Team A then portfolio trys to add project C work to project A sprints which is not what i'm looking for.

Also if a resource finishes work on Project A and is no longer required then they can start on Project C but current setup does not seem to allow that.

Hope that makes sense.

Thanks
fields.summary: Allow multiple boards to be assigned to one team
Stream for releases(like traditional version of portfolio)
Schedule calculation fails for very large Scrum teams

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1568].
  {panel}

h2. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a board with 2 sprints and 1 story
 # Move the story into the first sprint. Start the sprint.
 # Close the sprint. The story should now be in the backlog
 # Create a Portfolio plan based on the board
 # Assign the issue to the board team. Commit.
 # Assign the issue to the second sprint.
 # We see "1 Uncommitted change" at the top. Click the button

Expected:
 - We see the issue's sprint assignment in the commit dialog

Actual:
 - No changes are shown

h2. Workaround

There are 2 workarounds:

1. Change the issues team to calculate, then change it back to the proper team. Then assign the sprint. Then commit the issue.
 2. Assign the issue to a sprint manually inside JIRA. The commit dialog should then show the uncommitted change of the issue's sprint.
fields.summary: Sprint assignments don't show up in the commit dialog for issues that are assigned to closed sprints
You must add a zoom to see information about an issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1551].
  {panel}

*Problem*
Scheduling treats dependencies between issues in a way that blocked issues will be held back until the blocking issue was scheduled. This basically means that the blocked issue virtually gets "ranked" below the blocking issue (unless the rank order already matches the dependency order, i.e., the blocked issue has a lower rank than the blocking one). In certain situations (like two teams working on de facto independent backlogs) this behaviour leads to unintuitive / unexpected outcomes.

*Solution*
In order to allow scheduling to better adjust to the particular setup, an option to change this behaviour should be introduced. I want to be able to "pull up" blocking issues above my blocked issue to keep it from being scheduled later. Alternatively I would like scheduling to ignore dependencies and just have them visualized.
fields.summary: Allow to configure how Portfolio handles dependencies in scheduling

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1550].
  {panel}

When you forecast different things and you commit (commit is a strong word, you engage yourself, it's not only pushing data to jira), you validate something. When you're happy from a specific forecast if you commit, you are waiting for your commit to be translated to something.

Therefore, the commit dialog should show calculated sprints and allow pushing these calculated values to JIRA. These calculated values will then be set and not change when re-calculating.

We should then have the ability to reset sprints on issues to allow them to be calculated again. This could be done via the sprint flyout on the timeline.

(this issue was originally raised in JPO-1542)
fields.summary: Allow committing calculated sprints
Set non-working days to delay start of sprint in Portfolio

fields.description:
h4. +Summary+

After calculating sprints for stories in Portfolio Plan, Committing Changes doesn't push the stories to the corresponding Sprints in Agile Board
h4. +Steps to reproduce+
 # Create an Agile Board with 4 sprints
 # Create 2 stories in Sprint 1 and 6 stories in Sprint 2 (give them estimates in Story Points)
 # Create a Live Plan linking to the Agile Board
 (i) At this point, stories 1-2 are organized in Sprint 1 while stories 3-8 in Sprint 2 in the Live Plan (following Agile)
 # For stories 5-8, click the Sprints column and choose Calculate
 # Calculate the Plan
(i) In my case, stories 5-6 are pushed to Sprint 3, story 7 to Sprint 4, and story 8 to a new sprint created by Portfolio (not existent in the Agile Board):
 !plan.png|thumbnail!
 # Commit Changes back to Agile

h4. +Expected behavior+

Stories 5-6 are pushed to Sprint 3 and story 7 to Sprint 4 in the Agile Board. For story 8, since the Portfolio-created sprint doesn't exist in the Board, it may either remain in Sprint 2 or moved to the Backlog (the latter makes more sense)
h4. +Actual Behavior+

Stories 5-8 are all pushed to the Backlog in the Agile Board
h4. +Workaround+
 # Go to the Live Plan
 # Click the Sprints column and explicitly re-select the same sprint for the affected stories
 # Commit Changes
 (/) The stories will be pushed to the correct sprints and backlog in the Agile board
fields.summary: Stories are not pushed to correct Sprints in Agile Board upon Change Committed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1541].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, when a user makes some changes in JIRA Portfolio plan and commits the changes, the value (for the same field) of that issue on JIRA's side (done by other colleagues) will be overwritten.

In the case where the user who makes the changes in JIRA Portfolio is not aware of the changes others make in JIRA's side, this will discard the changes and could mess up reports. At this moment, users are suggested to refresh the browser page before applying changes in JIRA Portfolio and commit right away. This will require users to refresh the page and commit changes often

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have additional functionality in the commit feature to automatically check the last value entered (on JIRA's side) to be applied in Portfolio and adjust it accordingly in JIRA Portfolio before applying this changes back to JIRA's side.
fields.summary: Having a check on the last changes made in JIRA before JIRA Portfolio performs a commit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1540].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When viewing a board in portfolio, the default view will allow you to see Stories, and expand on them to also see their subtasks.  However when filtering by Team, the parent stories are still displayed, but trying to expand this does not display the subtasks of those stories as expected.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# creating a plan and using a board(s) that has stories w/ sub-tasks.
# Assign those stories to the automatic team created or import a shared team and assign.
# Identify the stories with sub-tasks without any filters set.
# Filter by the Team assigned to those issues.

h3. Expected Results
All issues display down to the sub-task level.

h3. Actual Results
Epics and stories display, but sub-tasks are not visible.
 
h3. Notes
It does not seem to matter who those subtasks are assigned to, they never display when any team filter is selected.

h3.Workaround
none


Screenshots of issue:
First screenshot shows those subtasks are viewable when no team filter is selected:
 !subtasksvisible.png|thumbnail! 


Second screenshot shows parent issue, but none of it's subtasks.  This happens when any value exists in the Team Filter.
 !teamfilterselected_nosubtasks.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Sub-tasks are not visible when filtering by team
Ability to set parent issue through a column

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1538].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
Estimation changes do not take place after commit if only it is only a one-time change

h4. Steps to reproduce
#  Import issue into JIRA Portfolio live plan
# Set estimation to 20 hours (This will be automatically distributed among configured stages, lets say 3 stages with 5/10/5)
# Now change their estimates so that it is divided between the stages as (0/0/20)
# Log 8 hours of work on that issue in JIRA side
# The remaining estimate in JIRA is now 12 hours (while estimation in JPO still shows 20 hours)
# The user now commits his change

h4. Expected Result
The remaining estimate in JIRA is now 20 hours

h4. Actual Result
The remaining estimate in JIRA is now 12 hours

h4. Additional information
# This bug only happens for the changes in such a way that the total estimation remains the same. As the above steps, total estimation stays at 20 hours.
# In addition, this is also reproducible only when the user does one-time changes. In this case, user just changes from 5/10/5 to 0/0/20. If the customer makes another changes before committing, the bug does not happen. For example, user changes from 5/10/5 to 0/0/20 to 0/10/10.
fields.summary: Estimation changes do not take place after commit if it is only a one-time change

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1535].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

Live plan only has the option to group the lines by _Global_ and _Project_ at the moment. As a user, I'd like more options to group them by the data sources such as board and filter.
- !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide an option to group the stream lines by board and filter
fields.summary: Option to group the stream line by board and filter

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1534].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

Portfolio doesn't currently have a feature to sort the projects in Live Plan (Scope view).
- !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Resolution

It would be great if there is a feature to sort the order of the projects.
fields.summary: A feature to sort projects in Live plan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1533].
{panel}

h3. Summary
In case there are certain fields required for specific issue types and this requirement condition is modelled with a [workflow validator|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/advanced-workflow-configuration-776636620.html#Advancedworkflowconfiguration-validators], Portfolio won't bring up the _Create issue_ dialog when trying to commit an issue of this type to JIRA - or will not show that field in the screen - and hence the issue creation will fail.

h3. Expected Behavior
Follow the configuration from JIRA's "Create Issue" screen, showing all of the fields that have been configured there also in the screen brought up by Portfolio.

h3. Actual Behavior
If there are required fields setup through the workflow, or if a workflow function require any fields that are not marked as "Required" in JIRA's field configuration, the issue creation through JPO will fail.

h3. Workaround
Set the field as "Required" via [field configurations and screens|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRACloud/Project+screens%2C+schemes+and+fields] and [specify the field behaviour|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRACloud/Specifying+field+behavior#Specifyingfieldbehavior-changingfieldsModifyingfieldbehavior] this way.
fields.summary: Cannot create issues when required fields are configured in workflow rather than field configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1532].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Scheduling algorithm considers Rank first than any other values such as dependencies. When there are multiple backlogs and teams working on the same Plan, it may get an unexpected result.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Have Backlog A and Backlog B runs in parallel on two different backlogs with assigned to two different teams.

Backlog A has the following backlog (rank in brackets):
 BACKLOGA-1 (1)
 BACKLOGA-2 (2)
 BACKLOGA-3 (3)
 BACKLOGA-4 (4)
 BACKLOGA-5 (5)

Backlog B has the following backlog (rank in brackets)
 BACKLOGB-1 (6)
 BACKLOGB-2 (7)
 BACKLOGB-3 (8)
 BACKLOGB-4 (9)
 BACKLOGB-5 (10)

If BACKLOGA-1 has a dependency on BACKLOGB-2 it does not schedule it straight after BACKLOGB-2 completes (which it should, because it is first in the backlog and has the highest rank).
h3. Expected Results

BACKLOGA-1 scheduled right after BACKLOGB-2
h3. Actual Results

BACKLOGA-1 scheduled after BACKLOGA-5
h3. Notes

This is because, in scheduling, Rank is considered first then other values such as dependency. It is an expected behaviour, JPO-1531 open to adding this in the documentation.
fields.summary: Schedule Dependency equal to Rank on Multiple backlog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1531].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Portfolio put the rank into priority when scheduling the issues. This may be confusing when dependencies are included into the equation.

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve the documentation to explain the expected behaviour when scheduling - which will be considered on priority (rank) and what will be considered in addition.
fields.summary: Improve Documentation on Dependency Handling
Allow to show completed issues for a specific date range

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1529].
  {panel}

This hierarchy below is an example of a higher level being added to the default hierarchy:
!hierarchy.PNG|thumbnail! 

I would like to be able to add a level below stories and remove sub-tasks. The reason for this is that stories can be used to represent requirements, but may or may not be able to be completed in a sprint. I would like to test these requirements via manual and automated testing at some point when they are finished, and complete tasks in sprints. 

JIRA doesn't deal we well with having items span multiple sprints, so I would like the tasks to be the work items completed sprint to sprint. This use case assumes a story isn't a product increment that can be finished in a sprint, but a goal or deliverable that will be worked through over time. For example, a slow infrastructure build, that isn't following agile manifesto, but is benefiting from some agile features.
fields.summary: Allow removing of sub-tasks in hierarchy and adding of lower levels

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1528].
  {panel}

Hi!

Our company considers JP as a tool to manage and track our business activities at portfolio / department level.

The problem is our 10000+ license JIRA is used both by IT teams and corporate divisons. It means that Hierarchy levels configured (theirs actual names) may pertain to one Line of business and mismatch another another one..

If there was a possibility somehow to define hierarchy levels per plan (or even though per plan's category/template), that would make it much easier.
fields.summary: Make hierarchy levels configurable per plan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1527].
  {panel}

h2. Description 

In some rare situations it is possible for a plan to accumulate "phantom" changes. The uncommitted changes indicator shows 1 or more changes, but on opening the commit dialog, none are visible. 
h2. Workaround 
h3. Cloud: 

[Contact support|https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/23] 

h3. Server: 

*WARNING:* This will remove ALL uncommitted changes for the plan. Make sure you commit/revert all your changes prior to attempting this. 

There is a hidden plan configuration screen that allows for resetting all pending changes (including but not limited to the phantom ones). This will make the phantom changes go away. This configuration screen can be accessed as follows: 
# Login as an administrator and go to [BASE-URL]/secure/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa
# Enable the {{com.atlassian.portfolio.plan.ExtendedAdministration}} dark feature on the JIRA instance. 
# Visit the plan configuration screen (open the plan, click the three-dot menu next to the plan name, then choose Configure). 
# Click on the new Extended Administration section in the column on the left (the dark feature makes this visible). 
# Confirm that you want to reset uncommitted changes.
fields.summary: Uncommitted changes indicator shows changes, but none are visible in commit dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1526].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

From time to time, users would want to find issues with empty Theme, Team, Story Point and other column selection so that they can fill them up accordingly. If there are a lot of issues in the Plan, it is a little bit difficult to find them.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide an option to filter out issues with empty Theme, Team, Story Point and other column selection.
fields.summary: An option to filter out issues with empty Story Point and Theme in a Scope View

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1525].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

When users update a Story in JIRA, they need to refresh the Portfolio plan so that it is updated with the latest data.
h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to auto update Portfolio Live plan without refreshing the page.
fields.summary: A feature to auto update live plan if there is a new update in JIRA without refreshing the page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1524].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There isn't a clear description explaining the feature to order by columns, its limitation and how to update it back to the default of Order By Rank.

h3. Suggested Solution
Describe and provide additional visual to understand when a scope is ordered by column and when it is ordered by rank (highlighted and not)
fields.summary: Document Order By columns on Live plans

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1523].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, Live plan only shows automatic changes in the issue table, but it is not reflected automatically in Graphical schedule UI. User would need to click on *Calculate* button to get it reflected in graphical schedule UI.  


h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have an automatic recalculation option in Live plan as we have it in Classic plan.
fields.summary: Having an automatic recalculation option in Live plan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1522].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
In the schedule/timeline view in Portfolio 2.0, hovering over a field with the cursor does no longer display labels. Previously, a label was shown so you could see the full title of the field, but this is no longer working for some browsers. 

h3. Environment
* Portfolio for JIRA - 2.0.1-OD-004-D20160606T234856
* Chrome
* Firefox
* Tried Safari initially and worked correctly, now it doesn't seem to work either.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in to your instance an open a Portfolio plan
# In the top right corner, click *Report* and then in the dropdown *Switch report* in the left side select *Schedule*
# Set the cursor over a field, a label should appear displaying the whole name, but it doesn't.

h3. Expected Results
After hovering with the cursor over any field a label would show up and display the whole title of such field.

h3. Actual Results
No label is shown, and as a result the whole title can not be seen.

h3.Workaround
There's no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Hovering in Portfolio 2.0 stopped working
Allow to define the maximum amount of parallel work items to be completed by a team
"Actual" chart in Theme report should account for issue resolution
Stories closed in current sprint should contribute to capacity
Filter Epics on Reports
View Over Allocated Sprints

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1515].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently if the initiatives is not part of the board filter, you cannot view it in the live plan.

h3. Suggested Solution
Appreciate an option to see Initiatives even if they are not part of the board filter because most of the time we don't want to see them in a board, but we want to have an overview of them in the live plan to be able to plan, filter by initiative etc.
fields.summary: option to view initiative even if they are not part of the board filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1514].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
All our Product Owners want to be able to plan Stories into releases/Fixed Version/s using the Back on the Agile board and then see a timeline view of this in a Portfolio Plan.
However, when the Portfolio plan/timeline is generated, Stories that haven't had a release/Fixed Version/s assigned to them often end up being automatically scheduled into Releases (and have a blue Release assignment in the Scope section of the Portfolio Plan). This behaviour is never desired in the way our Product Owners want to use Portfolio and always results in a lot of confusion and questions as unexpected Stories end up being included in releases

h3. Suggested Solution
To implement more flexibility in the scheduling configuration
fields.summary: option to stop the scheduling algorithm
Add default mapping feature of Sub-Task Estimates to Portfolio Skill Data

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1511].
  {panel}

In some situations, it was possible for a script error to be triggered when issues are loaded. One way of triggering this is:

1. Open two browser tabs.
2. In one tab, create a new release, and a new issue that is assigned to that release. Commit these changes.
3. In the second tab, trigger loading of new issues (e.g. by filtering for something).
4. A script error occurs.

Opening the issue details panel could also trigger this in some situations.
fields.summary: Potential script error when loading issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1510].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

When a board contains multiple parallel active Sprints, Portfolio only imports _one_ active Sprint per board and there is no way or option to select which Sprint to be imported. It also does not allow sprints to overlap in any way, even if the start date of one sprint takes place before the end date of another.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide an option to select which active Sprint to be imported from a board, and allow Portfolio to recognize and take advantage of the parallel sprints functionality, as right now it does not seem to know how to handle them properly.
fields.summary: Provide a feature to select an active Sprint from a board

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1507].
  {panel}

*Existing Behavior*

Values shown for a parent issue (e.g. progress, story points) are aggregated from the child issues below it. Child issues that have been filtered out or excluded from the plan are not considered in this aggregation.

*Suggested Change*

It would be nice to have a "To-Do" view that is all of the uncompleted issues, but still has the roll-up of progress. 
* "In our view, there's no reason to have the progress show no progress when all of the completed issues are hidden, because then it's completely blank."
fields.summary: Always take completed issues into account when calculating progress regardless of whether they match the current filter settings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1506].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

Portfolio doesn't currently have a report to display the total number of free capacity for each version.

h3. Suggested Resolution

It would be great to have a report that could display it.
fields.summary: Provide a report to display free capacity per version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1505].
  {panel}

To be able to change the source project of an issue after it has been created in Portfolio and before it has been committed. Users need to exclude the issue and recreate it in the desired project and input all the data again.

Use case:
* At the time of issue creation the project source isn't clear.
* Miss-click when creating issue
fields.summary: Allow to change the project for uncommitted issues

fields.description: In some situations, Portfolio does not allow committing issues that have required fields. Instead of showing the issue creation dialog, the commit dialog shows an error.
fields.summary: Cannot create issues that have required fields
Hierarchical view of issues on ”Review and commit changes" window/pop-up

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1502].
  {panel}

As a project manager I need to be able to set the number of assignees per story for each story to correctly project out the tentative release date and team capacity.

For some larger issues it is realistic to have 2,3, or more developers working on a task but other tasks cannot be accomplished by developers working in parallel. 

Additionally, some teams can work this way, some cannot. I'd prefer not to create a Portfolio Plan for each team only so I can configure different scheduling.

While it could be argued that a large task could be broken down into smaller tasks and set the "Maximum assignees per story" to 1 it's not always that easy when the requirements are not yet detailed to break down and/or you simply need to project across multiple future releases.  This allows us to justify hiring early enough to onboard, and get up to speed in time.
fields.summary: Support Per Issue/Subtask "Maximum assignees per story"
Allow default team assignments for unestimated issues
Portfolio Administrator permission should give access to Shared Team Management

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to create Live Plans with more than 1000 versions in Oracle due to ORA-01795: maximum number of expressions in a list is 1000

h3. Environment
* Oracle Database 11g
* Large JIRA applications installations with thousands of versions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to Portfolio > Create Plan.
# Enter any name and click Next.
# Select a board or a filter whose referenced projects contain more than 1000 versions (e.g. a JQL filter referencing 3 projects with 400 versions in each project).
# Click Next.

h3. Expected Results
The Live Plan is created successfully.

h3. Actual Results
You get an error banner with the message *Bummer, something has gone terribly wrong here...*:
!error.png|thumbnail!

Clicking on 'Show Details', the following error is displayed:
*Error reading enrichment information for versions*
{noformat}
com.atlassian.jpo.common.PersistenceException: Error reading enrichment information for versions

  at com.atlassian.jpo.version.sql.QueryDslVersionEnrichmentPersistence.getVersionEnrichments:85
  at com.atlassian.jpo.version.DefaultVersionService.enrichEnvironmentProjects:268
  at com.atlassian.jpo.project.ProjectService.getDeepProjects:122
  at com.atlassian.jpo.project.ProjectService.getDeepProjectsById:101
  at com.atlassian.rm.jpo.issueloading.lucene.issuesource.context.DefaultIssueSourceContextService.getProjectInfosForIssueSources:60
  at com.atlassian.jpo.rest.service.plan.setup.projects.PlanSetupProjectsRestEndpoint.getProjects:56
  (...)
  Caused by com.mysema.query.QueryException: Caught SQLSyntaxErrorException for select "versionRankItem"."ID", "versionRankItem"."ENV_ID", "versionRankItem"."DELTA" from "AO_D9132D_VERSION_ENRICHMENT" "versionRankItem" where "versionRankItem"."ENV_ID" in (?, ?, (...), ?, ?)

  at com.mysema.query.sql.DefaultSQLExceptionTranslator.translate:38
  at com.mysema.query.sql.Configuration.translate:514
  (...)
Caused by java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorException: ORA-01795: maximum number of expressions in a list is 1000 

  at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIoer.processError:440
  at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIoer.processError:396
(...)
{noformat}

The full exception can also be found in the catalina.out file.
 
h3. Notes
This was tested on JIRA 6.4.12.
I've attached the full stack trace to this bug: [^exception.txt]
fields.summary: Unable to create Live Plan with more than 1000 versions in Oracle

h3. Workaround

Based on our investigations so far, this bug occurs when calculating the schedule (work assignments) for Agile sprints if the capacity of at least one of the people working on this sprint is exceeded.
In order to get the plan working again please adapt the scope of all imported Agile sprints manually by either removing issues from the sprint or adapting their estimates.

We are working on this and hope to provide fix soon.
fields.summary: "No feasible solution" exception in scheduling result for Portfolio live plan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1497].
  {panel}

*Problem*
Sprint end dates are mapped to the end of a day within Portfolio. That is, if there is a sprint ending on 15/Jun/16, 11:23:17, Portfolio will map its end date to 15/Jun/16, 23:59:59. Similar, sprint start dates are mapped to the beginning of the respective day. This is due to Portfolio scheduling on a day-granularity and hence timestamps have to be mapped to either the start or end of a day. As a consequence, the duration of that sprint might appear longer by one day than it actually is. For instance, a sprint running from 15/Jun/16, 11:23:17 - 16/Jun/16, 11:23:16 would have a duration of 2 days in Portfolio even though its actual duration is just one day. This leads to an inflated capacity for that sprint.

*Expected behaviour*
The sprint duration should be accurate, however, due to Portfolio's day granularity, the sprint start/end timestamps cannot be matched, a better heuristic might help (mapping timestamps from the afternoon to end-of-day, mapping timestamps from before noon to beginning-of-day).
fields.summary: Improve start and end date handling of Agile sprints in Live Plans
Ability to publish / share reports

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1495].
  {panel}

When creating a plan based off of a board with an active sprint, issues are included in plan even though they are not selected on the Scope page when configuring issue source.
* These issues are "Done" status and do not appear on the Scope page at all.

h5. Steps to reproduce
# Create JIRA Software Scrum Software Development project, add sprint
# Create issue and add to sprint, start sprint and then change issue status to "Done"
# Create plan using scrum board as source (use default selections on releases, teams, and scope pages)
#* On the "Confirm what's in scope" page, note no issues appear and "0 selected"
# Expand "Issues without parent Epic" and note that the "Done" issue was included in plan.

h5. Expected Behavior
Creating a plan with "0 selected" on the Scope page should create a plan that contains no issues. 
* These "Done" issues should either not be included in the new plan or they should show up on the Scope page so that they can be selected or un-selected

h5. Workaround
After you create the plan you can exclude the "Done" issues. You can do this by checking the issue box and clicking "Exclude from plan".
fields.summary: Done issues in active sprint not showing in issue source but are still added to plan
Ability to sort Shared Teams

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1493].
  {panel}

Certain stage and/or skill setups might cause the time estimate update on an issue to result in an error when editing estimates directly on a stage or skill.

*Workaround*
Try clearing all estimates on that issue and re-set them

We are working on a fix already, should be out next week for BTF and Cloud.
fields.summary: Live Plans - potential rounding errors cause time estimate changes in scope table to fail

fields.description:
I created a team in portfolio and added the members without problems. Now I wanted to set the global availability of a member to end at a certain time as he is leaving the company.

First of all the UI won't let me set the date as the input element is disabled. Clicking the "manage" link forwards me to an error page saying I would not have the permission to manage my team although I'm in the administrators and site-admins group and can add/delete users across all atlassian products. I would not know what other permissions/groups I would need for  this.

As this behaviour also prevents me from inserting vacation times for members (which is a very common use case) this breaks the main point of portfolio which is IMO the planning with resources.
fields.summary: unable to access team management although admin access

fields.summary: Creating new plan fails at step 3

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1490].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*

In Portfolio's live plans, it looks like when viewing the 'epic' hierarchy level, the timeline will show the overall duration of the epic including its children. When viewing the 'story' hierarchy level, epics normally don't show up at all unless there is an estimate set on the epic. This 'unstructured' part of the epic that is not represented by any of its stories will be visible in the timeline even when viewing the 'story' level.

*Suggested Solution*

Raise a documentation for Portfolio to explain the behaviour so user can understand it.

*Workaround*

None.
fields.summary: Portfolio Epic in Live Plans

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1489].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, you are not able to have usage tracking for JIRA Portfolio which some customer require for further analysis to determine whether if there are under/over utilizing JIRA Portfolio.
h3. Suggested Solution
It would be good if we can perform the following tracking:
* Which users/projects are using this? 
* When it was used last time? 
* How frequently?
fields.summary: usage tracking for JIRA Portfolio
"Completion date" filter should not default to "beginning of sprint" when plan has no sprints

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1487].
  {panel}

While the capacity view is showing or the schedule is closed an error is thrown when selecting an item in the Scope table.

*Wordaround*
Switch back to the schedule in order to make the table selection work.

Fix has been released in 2.0.2 for server customers. Fix for cloud customers has also been released (v2.0.3-OD-001).
fields.summary: Error when selecting issues in the scope table with capacity view showing or the schedule is closed
Inflated capacity when ending/starting consecutive sprints the same day
Error: "This view is only available if all teams are on the same schedule."

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1484].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in Live Plans, to add an item into the backlog, you need to edit the issue source to add a single existing issue.  Previously there was an import button that allowed you to add items in easily: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAPortfolioServer/Importing+existing+issues+to+the+backlog

h3. Suggested Solution
Reimplement the import button, or another way to easily add items.

h3. Workaround 
Edit the issue source to add an item into the scope in step 3 of the wizard:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAPortfolioServer/Configuring+plan+settings

Alternatively if an item is removed in error and has not been committed, the change can be reverted from the uncommitted changes menu: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAPortfolioServer/Committing+your+plan+changes
fields.summary: As a user I would like to import existing items to the scope or backlog with one click
Add default estimates to 2.0 plans

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-1482].
  {panel}

*Problem:*
The epic issue type is hard-wired to the 2nd hierarchy level in Portfolio (one above the lowest standard issue types level and two above the sub-tasks level). This can be limiting in case more hierarchy levels are required under the epic issue type.

*Workaround:*
For the time being, another issue type needs to be used to fulfil the purpose of the epic issue type. This type can then be mapped to any hierarchy level and thus will allow for more hierarchy levels below.

*Solution:*
Allow mapping the epic issue type to other hierarchy levels and also allow for the levels below to be changed too.
fields.summary: Make mapping of Epic issue type and below configurable in Live Plans hierarchy configuration
